column4: I have a stange issue with the sound controls. I'm trying to use skype with a headset (directly connected to the sound card).
I have it working in sound recorder and to a certain extent in skype, but I can barely get "hello" out before alsamixer turns the capture volume to a barely audible level.
Any ideas why it would continuously turn the sound down?
I don't think I have an auto-adjust button.
initialize driver to a default state.
Also, do "sudo alsactl store" after that.
New Ubuntu installation or not, it's a bug.
It reset the alsa configuration, as expected, but the problem still persists.
alsamixer -- you set up all bars up?
Try "sudo alsactl init"  --- No storing this time.
That seemed to have worked somewhat.
Change it with alsamixer.  Don't use store.  See if that helps.
Nope. No luck. sudo alsamixer in the terminal. Turned it all the way up.
